User provide high-level research directi.Format: Natural language description of a protein target, phenotype, or biological goal.
User provide high-level research directi.Example: A chemist provides a target description, such as a UniProt protein description or disease phenotype.
User provide high-level research directi.Role in workflow: Defines the biological or pharmacological objective for molecule generation.

User provide representations or formal i.Format: Protein descriptions (UniProt, PDB), SMILES strings for molecules.
User provide representations or formal i.Example: Protein description for GRK4 (UniProt P32298; PDB 4YHJ), SMILES strings in BioAssay tables.
User provide representations or formal i.Role in workflow: Serves as input for retrieval and as context for LLM-based molecule generation.

Query Decomposition.Method details: LLM extracts keywords from the user-provided protein/phenotype description to guide BioAssay retrieval.
Query Decomposition.Example: Extracting relevant keywords from a UniProt protein description.

Textual or Knowledge Embedding.Method details: OpenAI text embedding tool converts protein descriptions and BioAssay records into vector embeddings for similarity search.
Textual or Knowledge Embedding.Outputs: Vector embeddings for semantic similarity calculation.
Textual or Knowledge Embedding.Example: Embedding UniProt description and BioAssay text for cosine similarity search.
Textual or Knowledge Embedding.Role in workflow: Enables semantic retrieval of relevant BioAssays.

Biological or Phenotypic Embedding.Method details: Protein and BioAssay descriptions are embedded to capture biological/phenotypic similarity.
Biological or Phenotypic Embedding.Example: Embedding protein and BioAssay text for cross-target retrieval.
Biological or Phenotypic Embedding.Role in workflow: Supports retrieval of BioAssays relevant to biological function, not just sequence.

Pattern and Feature Extraction.Method details: LLM summarizes BioAssay findings, extracts key results, and identifies active/inactive molecules from experimental tables.
Pattern and Feature Extraction.Outputs: Summaries, lists of active/inactive molecules, extracted activity values.
Pattern and Feature Extraction.Example: Extracting IC50 values and activity labels from BioAssay tables.
Pattern and Feature Extraction.Role in workflow: Provides structured context for molecule generation.

Property and Annotation Extraction.Method details: LLM extracts pharmacodynamic parameters (IC50, Ki, Kd, percent inhibition) and activity annotations from BioAssay tables.
Property and Annotation Extraction.Example: Extracting IC50 = 2100 nM for a molecule.
Property and Annotation Extraction.Role in workflow: Informs LLM about molecule activity for generation.

Literature and Data Retrieval via APIs.Method details: Automated retrieval of BioAssay records from PubChem using API queries based on protein/phenotype description.
Literature and Data Retrieval via APIs.Example: Querying PubChem for BioAssays related to GRK4.
Literature and Data Retrieval via APIs.Role in workflow: Collects experimental screening data for context.

Data Retrieval with Prioritization and F.Method details: LLM and rule-based filters prioritize BioAssays by relevance, exclude direct matches, and filter by data table size.
Data Retrieval with Prioritization and F.Example: Excluding BioAssays with direct UniProt ID matches or too few molecules.
Data Retrieval with Prioritization and F.Role in workflow: Ensures only relevant, informative BioAssays are used.

Domain-Specific Data Retrieval and Reaso.Method details: LLM assesses biological relevance of retrieved BioAssays to the query protein/phenotype.
Domain-Specific Data Retrieval and Reaso.Example: LLM determines if a GRK2 BioAssay is relevant to a GRK4 query.

Literature data Retrieval via Semantic a.Method details: Cosine similarity between embeddings of protein descriptions and BioAssay records guides retrieval.
Literature data Retrieval via Semantic a.Inputs: Embeddings of protein and BioAssay text.
Literature data Retrieval via Semantic a.Outputs: Ranked list of BioAssays by semantic similarity.
Literature data Retrieval via Semantic a.Example: Selecting top-k BioAssays with highest cosine similarity.
Literature data Retrieval via Semantic a.Role in workflow: Focuses retrieval on semantically relevant assays.

Domain-Specific Literature data Retrieva.Method details: Queries PubChem BioAssay repository using domain-specific identifiers (UniProt, PDB).
Domain-Specific Literature data Retrieva.Outputs: BioAssay records relevant to the domain.
Domain-Specific Literature data Retrieva.Example: Using UniProt ID to retrieve BioAssays for a protein.
Domain-Specific Literature data Retrieva.Role in workflow: Ensures domain relevance in data retrieval.

Data Retrieval via Domain-Specific Repos.Method details: Direct queries to PubChem BioAssay database for experimental screening data.
Data Retrieval via Domain-Specific Repos.Outputs: BioAssay JSON records and data tables.
Data Retrieval via Domain-Specific Repos.Role in workflow: Provides experimental context for molecule generation.

Concise Synopsis and Summarization of Li.Method details: LLM summarizes BioAssay purpose, methodology, and key findings from JSON records.
Concise Synopsis and Summarization of Li.Example: Summarizing a BioAssay measuring GRK5 inhibition.
Concise Synopsis and Summarization of Li.Role in workflow: Condenses unstructured assay data for LLM input.

Facet-Based or Field-Specific Extraction.Method details: LLM extracts assay type, counterscreen status, and key observations from BioAssay records.
Facet-Based or Field-Specific Extraction.Outputs: Structured fields: assay type, counterscreen flag, observations.
Facet-Based or Field-Specific Extraction.Role in workflow: Structures context for downstream molecule generation.

Domain-Tailored Extraction from Literatu.Method details: LLM identifies counterscreen assays and extracts domain-specific insights (e.g., PAINS, off-targets).
Domain-Tailored Extraction from Literatu.Example: Flagging a BioAssay as a counterscreen for hERG.
Domain-Tailored Extraction from Literatu.Role in workflow: Guides molecule generation to avoid undesirable activities.

Idea/hypothesis generation without addit.Method details: LLMs generate molecules using only the protein description as prompt (ablation study).
Idea/hypothesis generation without addit.Outputs: Generated SMILES strings for candidate molecules.
Idea/hypothesis generation without addit.Example: Generating molecules for GRK4 using only its UniProt description.
Idea/hypothesis generation without addit.Role in workflow: Tests LLM's baseline molecule generation ability.

Generate ideas/hypotheses using Domain-S.Method details: LLMs (GPT 4o, DeepSeekV3, Gemma-3-27B) act as molecular design agents, generating molecules from BioAssay context.
Generate ideas/hypotheses using Domain-S.Inputs: Protein description, BioAssay summaries, experimental data.
Generate ideas/hypotheses using Domain-S.Example: LLM generates 10 molecules with high predicted activity for a target.
Generate ideas/hypotheses using Domain-S.Role in workflow: Synthesizes new candidate molecules tailored to biological context.

Literature data used during idea/hypothe.Method details: LLM uses retrieved BioAssay summaries and experimental tables as context for molecule generation.
Literature data used during idea/hypothe.Example: Generating molecules using active/inactive compounds from BioAssay tables.
Literature data used during idea/hypothe.Role in workflow: Informs molecule generation with empirical screening data.

Summarization Literature data used durin.Method details: LLM-generated summaries of BioAssay findings are included in the molecule generation prompt.
Summarization Literature data used durin.Example: Summarized BioAssay findings included in generation prompt.
Summarization Literature data used durin.Role in workflow: Provides concise, relevant context for hypothesis generation.

Idea/hypothesis generation via Pattern D.Method details: LLM identifies patterns in active/inactive molecules and their properties from BioAssay tables.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Pattern D.Example: Learning from IC50 trends in BioAssay data.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Pattern D.Role in workflow: Guides LLM to generate molecules with desired activity profiles.

Idea/hypothesis generation via Few-Shot.Method details: LLM uses a small set of active/inactive molecules from BioAssay tables as in-context examples for generation.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Few-Shot.Example: Providing 8 active and 8 inactive molecules as prompt context.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Few-Shot.Role in workflow: Enables few-shot learning for molecule design.

Idea/hypothesis generation via Feature-D.Method details: LLM leverages extracted molecular features (e.g., functional groups, activity values) to guide molecule generation.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Feature-D.Outputs: Molecules predicted to have desired properties.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Feature-D.Example: Designing molecules to avoid PAINS and maximize affinity.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Feature-D.Role in workflow: Improves specificity and drug-likeness of generated molecules.

LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Method details: LLM justifies molecule selection, explaining how reference molecules and assay results guided design.
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Example: LLM explains why generated molecules should have high affinity and specificity.
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Role in workflow: Ensures scientific rationale for molecule selection.

LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Method details: LLM evaluates generated molecules for drug-likeness, specificity, and avoidance of PAINS.
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Example: LLM avoids generating molecules with PAINS motifs.

LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Method details: LLM assesses relevance of BioAssays to the query protein, labels context as high/medium/low relevance.
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Example: LLM labels a BioAssay as relevant or not to the target.
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Role in workflow: Improves context quality for molecule generation.

Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Quantitat.Method details: Generated molecules are evaluated using docking scores (Vina), QED, synthetic accessibility, and diversity metrics.
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Quantitat.Outputs: Quantitative scores for binding, drug-likeness, and diversity.
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Quantitat.Example: Comparing docking scores of generated molecules to FDA drugs.

Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Human/Exp.Method details: Manual review of BioAssay relevance and generated molecule quality by expert chemists.
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Human/Exp.Example: Manual evaluation of LLM relevance assessment for 25 targets.
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Human/Exp.Role in workflow: Validates automated relevance and generation steps.

Experimental Design Generation via Few-S.Method details: LLM uses few-shot examples from BioAssay data to guide molecule optimization (e.g., for hERG counterscreen).
Experimental Design Generation via Few-S.Outputs: Optimized molecules with reduced off-target activity.
Experimental Design Generation via Few-S.Example: Optimizing molecules to reduce hERG binding using counterscreen context.
Experimental Design Generation via Few-S.Role in workflow: Designs safer molecules by learning from counterscreen data.

Test Execution via Computational or In-S.Method details: Generated molecules are computationally evaluated using AutoDock Vina for docking, ADMETlab for hERG prediction, and RDKit for QED/SA.
Test Execution via Computational or In-S.Inputs: Generated molecules, protein structures, ADMETlab models.
Test Execution via Computational or In-S.Outputs: Docking scores, predicted hERG scores, QED, SA, diversity metrics.
Test Execution via Computational or In-S.Example: Docking generated molecules to GRK4 and predicting hERG scores.
Test Execution via Computational or In-S.Role in workflow: Validates candidate molecules computationally before experimental consideration.

Refinement via guided by computational-d.Method details: Docking and hERG prediction results are used to iteratively optimize molecules (e.g., reduce hERG affinity while maintaining target binding).
Refinement via guided by computational-d.Example: LLM optimizes molecules to lower hERG score after initial computational evaluation.
Refinement via guided by computational-d.Role in workflow: Improves candidate quality based on computational feedback.

Refinement via Performance-metric.Method details: Performance metrics (docking score, QED, SA, diversity) guide selection and further optimization of molecules.
Refinement via Performance-metric.Example: Selecting molecules with best docking and drug-likeness scores.
Refinement via Performance-metric.Role in workflow: Ensures only high-quality candidates are advanced.

paper_title: Assay2Mol: large language model-based drug design using BioAssay context
